___coordinate.description: Node coordinates as either an (x, y) or (x, y, z) tuple, the tuple is unbounded to allow additional dimensions to be used in addition to x, y and z coordinates
___coordinate.title: Node coordinates

___bel_function_type.description: BEL function types such as proteinAbundance, trancriptionalActivity, etc

___relation.description: Relationship between nodes in edge - may be directed or undirected
___relation.title: Edge relationship

___causal.description: True if a BEL causal edge type

___species_common_name.description: Species common name, e.g. human, mouse, rat
___species_common_name.title: Species Common Name

description: Graph data description. Please note that all field keys are to be lowercase and use snake-case (e.g. words are separated by underscores like ncbi_tax_id). Some of the metadata fields are not required but are included as exemplars for generating interoperable BEL JGF files.  You may need to provide additional validation programmatically to confirm that the metadata you need for your application exists.

___coordinate.description: Node coordinates as either an (x, y) or (x, y, z) tuple, the tuple is unbounded to allow additional dimensions to be used in addition to x, y and z coordinates
___coordinate.title: Node coordinates

___bel_function_type.description: BEL function types such as proteinAbundance, trancriptionalActivity, etc

___relation.description: Relationship between nodes in edge - may be directed or undirected
___relation.title: Edge relationship

___causal.description: True if a BEL causal edge type

___citation.description: Citation to support the evidence presented for the Edge
___citation.title: Citation for Edge Evidence

___name.description: Name or citation string for the reference.
___name.title: Citation Name

___id.description: Identifier of the citation, e.g. PubMed ID
___id.title: Citation ID

___ncbi_tax_id.description: NCBI taxonomy id - e.g. 9606 is the id for Homo sapien
___ncbi_tax_id.title: NCBI Taxonomy ID

___species_common_name.description: Common name for species like human, mouse or rat
___species_common_name.title: Species common name

___summary_text.description: Abstract from source text to provide support for this evidence
___summary_text.title: Summary Text

___species_common_name.description: Species common name, e.g. human, mouse, rat
___species_common_name.title: Species Common Name
